title: Credits
text: app built thanks : {shiny} – interactive app framework {ggplot2} – plotting {qqplotr} – QQ/PP geoms confidence bands {patchwork} – arranging multiple plots {purrr} – mapping utilities {glue} – labeling string interpolation {sn} – skew‑normal random number generation examples {stats} – base R distributions tests (e.g., Shapiro–Wilk)

title: Credits
text: Author: Daniel Wikstrom Assistance: ChatGPT (OpenAI) — models GPT‑4o GPT‑5 Thinking used code writing, review, documentation, formatting. use app teaching publications, please cite packages (see package’s citation()), acknowledge assistance appropriate.

title: Get started with exsampler
text: page provides overview exsampler package. exsampler tool assist visual inspection (non)normality. displays 3×3 grid one panel contains real data others contain simulated normal samples (Shapiro–Wilk p’s < 0.1) mean/SD (optionally rounding). choose variable, plot type, whether simulations match original’s granularity.

title: Get started with exsampler
text: Note: Replace CRAN line publish.
code: # install.packages("exsampler")  # when on CRAN # Development version from GitHub: # remotes::install_github("wikstromd/exsampler")

title: Get started with exsampler
text: Launch app demo mode (uses package’s built‑example data) : ’s —setup required.

title: Get started with exsampler
text: Histogram – density normal overlays. QQ plot / Detrended QQ plot – compare sample quantiles normal reference. PP plot – compare empirical CDF normal CDF. 3×3 grid panels – one panel contains real data; rest simulated normal distributions (Shapiro Wilk p < 0.1) mean/SD (optionally rounding). Click Generate Plots create fresh grid simulations. sidebar lets choose variable, plot type, whether match simulated data granularity (useful integer‑like scales).

title: Get started with exsampler
text: default, bands shown (keeps view uncluttered). can toggle bands sidebar: QQ plots: Pointwise, Bootstrap, Tail‑Sensitive (TS), Kolmogorov–Smirnov (KS). PP plots: Pointwise . QQ PP plots confidence bands rendered using {qqplotr} package (see: https://aloy.github.io/qqplotr/articles/introduction.html).

title: References
text: following R packages used exsampler package: shiny – interactive app framework (Chang et al., 2025) ggplot2 – plotting (Wickham, 2016) qqplotr – QQ/PP plots confidence bands (Almeida, Loy, & Hofmann, 2018) patchwork – arranging multiple plots (Pedersen, 2025) purrr – mapping utilities (Wickham & Henry, 2025) glue – labeling string interpolation (Hester & Bryan, 2024) sn – skew-normal random number generation example dataset (Azzalini, 2023) stats – base R distributions tests (e.g., Shapiro–Wilk) (R Core Team, 2025)

title: References
text: ChatGPT models GPT‑4o GPT‑5 Thinking (OpenAI, 2024; OpenAI, 2025) used code writing, review, documentation, formatting.

what: Generate a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
title: Generate a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
text: Simulate n - 1 additional samples normal distribution mean, standard deviation, (optionally) increment spacing real data, shuffle together “find real data” grid.

title: Generate a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
code: generate_random_data_for_plot_grid(   data,   variable_name,   seed_modifier = 1,   n = 9,   match_increment = TRUE,   p_thresh = 0.1,   max_attempts = 50 )

title: Generate a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
text: data data.frame containing real observations. variable_name Character; name numeric column data simulate . seed_modifier Integer; seed set.seed(), click gives new shuffle. n Integer; total number grids (1 real + n - 1 simulated). match_increment Logical; TRUE, rounds simulated values increment real data (via estimate_data_increment). p_thresh Numeric; required Shapiro–Wilk p-value threshold (default 0.10 means “looks normal enough”). max_attempts Integer; max resimulation attempts per simulated sample (default 50).

title: Generate a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
text: list elements: shuffled_data_frames: list data.frames, columns sample_data (values) .type ("real" "sim1", "sim2", …), random order. variable_name: always "sample_data" (downstream plotting). real_position: 1-based index shuffled_data_frames real data landed. grid_cols: integer number columns layout (fixed 3).

title: Generate a grid of simulated datasets matching a real variable — generate_random_data_for_plot_grid
text: Ensures simulated sample passes Shapiro–Wilk normality test p >= p_thresh (defaults 0.10), max_attempts retries.

title: Launch the Shiny App — run_app
text: function launches exsampler interactive Shiny app.

title: Launch the Shiny App — run_app
text: Runs Shiny app.

what: Scale to 0–10 Rescales a numeric vector to 0–10. NAs are ignored for the range and preserved. Zero/non-finite range returns all zeros. — scale_to_0_10
